alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 19 at 6:02PM CDT until August 19 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LOUISA...SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSON AND WESTERN MUSCATINE COUNTIES... At 602 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Nichols, or 11 miles west of Muscatine, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Muscatine, Columbus Junction, West Liberty, Conesville, Nichols, Atalissa, Saulsbury Bridge Campground, Cranston, Muscatine County Fairgrounds, Ardon and Gladwin. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
